channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Wed, 28 Aug 2024 02:20:19 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump mocked for launching bizarre NFT cards featuring him dancing: 'Imagine voting for this fraudster'
item.description: ​Donald Trump Tuesday announced the launch of a fresh batch of digital trading cards where Trump will be seen dancing, posing as a "sneakerhead" wearing his own line of golden shoes, clad in an Iron Man-like suit etc. The fundraising push comes as Harris-Walz merch have been an instant hit in the market. Trump announced the launch of the America First collection featuring 50 images. The cards cost $99 each.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says he's reached agreement with Kamala Harris for Sept 10 debate. Rules are...
item.description: ​ After much dillydally over debate, Donald Trump Tuesday announced he had agreed with the Kamala Harris camp for the September 10 debate on ABC news -- the first debate between the two after Joe Biden pulled out of the presidential race following his CNN debate debacle. Trump and Kamala camps had been warring over the debate rules for quite some time. In his social media post, Trump announced that the debate rules will be same as the last CNN debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Is she OK': Scotty McCreery halts concert to address assault on woman in crowd
item.description: Scotty McCreery paused his concert at the Colorado State Fair after observing a man assaulting a woman in the crowd. Addressing security and police, he expressed shock over the incident. Colorado State Fair officials later confirmed the incident, stating it is under investigation. The motive behind the alleged assault was not immediately disclosed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nobody knows who they are: Trump campaign on Bush, McCain staffers endorsing Harris
item.description: The Donald Trump campaign laughed it off and said nobody knows these people. The open letter is hilarious, Trump campaign spokesperson Steven Cheung said. "Nobody knows who these people are. They would rather see the country burn down than to see President Trump successfully return to the White House to Make America Great Again," the spokesperson said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Both Tulsi Gabbard and RFK Jr to be on Trump's transition team
item.description: Donald Trump has added both Robert F Kennedy Jr and Tulsi Gabbard -- the two new endorsers of the former president -- to his transition team. "As President Trump’s broad coalition of supporters and endorsers expands across partisan lines, we are proud that Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Tulsi Gabbard have been added to the Trump/Vance Transition team," senior adviser, Brian Hughes, said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal family decides to 'ignore' Harry and Meghan Markle. Now the focus will be on...
item.description: King Charles and Queen Camilla are shifting focus to younger royals until 2030, aiming to secure the monarchy's future. During discussions at Balmoral, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were absent. The King is considering unofficial roles for other royals and might distance himself from the Sussexes, affecting their position in the line of succession.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If she wants to build border wall...': JD Vance on Kamala Harris 'flip-flop'
item.description: GOP vice presidential candidate JD Vance Tuesday called out Kamala Harris and said if she wants to build a border wall, she has all the time. JD Vance's comment came as Republicans said Kamala Harris is doing a policy flip-flop on US southern border wall. Once she called this un-American and a medieval vanity project but now going by her commitment to reviving a bipartisan deal, she agreed to spending hundreds of millions on the border wall -- a pet project of Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sloth Fever' enters USA: Florida reports 20 travel-related cases, New York 1
item.description: Florida has reported 20 travel-related cases of sloth fever, including one in New York. US health officials monitor the situation while CDC confirms no local transmission. Over 8,000 cases this year spread by insects in countries including Brazil and Cuba. Patients are advised to rest as there is no specific treatment available.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian-origin tech influencer under fire for this suggestion to get US citizenship
item.description: ​Indian-origin tech influencer, former Google engineer and an investor in US, Debarghya (Deedy) Das has com under fire for his guide to US citizenship in which he detailed how he got scholarly articles written by a firm in his name. The blog was published earlier but blew up after this part was noticed by several X users who slammed the green card holder for advising to commit scientific fraud to get American citizenship. The blog was amended after the flak.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delta plane tyre explodes at Atlanta airport, 2 killed
item.description: ​One Delta employee and a contract worker were killed Tuesday morning when a tyre of a plane exploded when it was being removed from a Delta plane at the Atlanta International airport. The plane travelled from Las Vegas to Atlanta on Sunday. The reason for the tyre explosion was not immediately clear.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Foo Fighters to donate to Kamala Harris' presidential campaign following Trump’s use of their song 'My Hero'
item.description: The Foo Fighters expressed their displeasure over the use of their song "My Hero" at Donald Trump's rally in Arizona without permission, confirming this on social media and stating any royalties will be donated to Kamala Harris' presidential campaign. The band joins other artists in objecting to the unauthorized use of their music by Trump's campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz posed with two different dogs but Republicans think he's lying: Viral post
item.description: Earlier, the Republicans claimed that Tim Walz lied about going to a war and getting their children through IVF. The truth is Tim Walz served in the military but did not go to any war and his children were conceived through a different fertility method -- IUI. But the claim that Tim Walz lied about his dog Scout was fake news and the post was called out by other social media users -- but not before it was widespread.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump reups rigged election charge on back of Mark Zuckerberg's admission of Harris-Biden pressure
item.description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg made an explosive admission Monday that Facebook was pressured by the Biden-Harris administration during Covid. On the back of this acknowledgement, former president Donald Trump reupped his charge that the 2020 election was rigged. He said the revelation was what everyone has been waiting for.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman sues American Airlines for sexual assault on flight: 'They didn't prevent'
item.description: A New Jersey woman sued American Airlines for not doing enough to stop her from getting sexually assaulted by a stranger male passenger who was sitting next to her in a two-hour flight in 2022. The Independent reported that flight was going from North Carolina to Newark Liberty International Airport where the woman was seated between her friend and an unknown male passenger.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli military rescues hostage abducted in Hamas' October 7 attack
item.description: The Israeli military has rescued a 52-year-old Arab citizen, Qaid Farhan Alkadi, in a complex operation following his abduction by Hamas during their October 7 attack. This attack killed over 1,200 people and kidnapped nearly 250. Israel's retaliation has resulted in over 40,000 Palestinian deaths and widespread destruction in Gaza, displacing 90% of its population.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Fox host Jesse Watters jokes about generals 'having their way' with Kamala Harris: 'Not sexual'
item.description: Fox host Jesse Watters made unsavory comments about vice president Kamala Harris on air in a panel and when he was asked to take back his words, he said he did not mean what he said in a sexual way. “What is her foreign policy? This is where the president has his most impact. You have a lot of room to maneuver there as commander-in-chief. We don’t know who she is. We don’t know what she believes. She’s going to get paralyzed in the Situation Room while the generals have their way with her," Jesse said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk should be the hero but he became a villain because...: Kennedy Jr after Pavel Durov's arrest
item.description: "Somehow Elon Musk became the villain because he was actually the only platform that would allow free speech. He's now become a villain because the Democratic Party does not believe in the people," Kennedy said in an interview with Tucker Carlson as he commented on Telegram CEO's arrest. Pavel was arrested in France on allegations of drug trafficking and sexual abuse of children.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US presidential elections: Tulsi Gabbard endorses Donald Trump as moderate Republicans flee MAGA
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard, a former Congresswoman, endorsed Donald Trump for the US presidency, critiquing her former party for alleged misuse of America's institutions. Known for opposing Democratic policies, Gabbard's endorsement follows independent candidate Robert Kennedy Jr.'s support for Trump. The Trump campaign accused Kamala Harris of trying to alter debate rules, intensifying the ongoing political clash.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 'Take it in my stride': World's oldest man celebrates 112th birthday
item.description: John Alfred Tinniswood, the world's oldest man at 112, celebrated his milestone birthday in Merseyside. Born in 1912, he attributes his longevity to luck and a modest lifestyle, including a weekly tradition of fish and chips. He reflected on his life, offering insights on moderation and resilience while providing advice to younger generations to always give their best effort.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Deepfake outrage in South Korea: President Yoon calls for immediate action as Telegram faces backlash
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol called for an investigation into digital sex crimes after reports of deepfake images of South Korean women being shared on Telegram. The arrests of suspects, including Telegram's founder over related crimes, has heightened concerns. The Korea Communications Standards Commission plans to address the escalating issue in an upcoming meeting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
